lattice

Class Lattice

  • java.lang.Object
    • lattice.Lattice

  • public class Lattice
extends java.lang.Object
    A Lattice is a 3 Dimensional Array defining a collection of Cells through which fluid propagates as an approximation of Fluid Dynamics. Imagine each cell has a little packet of fluid in it, the lattice tracks how much fluid moves into each cell and at what rate. Much of this code is taken or else adapted from LatticeBoltzmannDemo.java By Daniel V. Schroeder. (http://physics.weber.edu/schroeder/fluids/LatticeBoltzmannDemo.java.txt) particularly the way the lattice is implemented and the streaming/collision/bouncing Schroeder's GUI was ignored, and a listener was added for changes in the lattice at each step/iteration, witch changes in the gui, the source of the omega term was shifted to the Liquid object/class. And sources and sinks were additionally added. A TODO would be to adjust the source/sink features to change the in/out flow of fluid of the sources/sinks collectively or even individually.
    Author:
    bonifantmc

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lattice

        public Lattice(int w,
               int l,
               Liquid liq,
               float[] u,
               java.util.List<Boundary> list,
               boolean empty)
        Create a three dimensional Lattice of c-dimensional Cells
        Parameters:
        w - the width of the lattice
        l - the length of the lattice
        c - the number of microscopic velocities each cell tracks
        liq - the liquid propagating along the lattice (provides its desisty, temperature, viscosity, and omega)
        u - incoming velocity
        list - a list of boundaries to add to the lattice
        empty - true if the lattice is being filled, otherwise false

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor(Lattice.ColorStats cs,
                               float factor,
                               int i,
                               int j)
        get the color of a given pixel in the lattice
        Parameters:
        cs - which Stat to base the retrieved Color on
        factor - multiple the value in the lattice by this, to intensify it
        i - the i/x coordinate of the pixel to get
        j - the j/y coordinate of the pixel to get
        Returns:
        the pixel color (which is the hsvtoRGB, the h is the value at the given coordinate multiplied by the given facotr)
